required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase III Trial With Diclofenac Sodium Medicated Plaster in Patients With Impact Injuries of the Limbs
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double Blind, Parallel-groups, Non-inferiority Versus Flector® and Superiority Versus Placebo, Phase III Clinical Trial With Diclofenac Sodium 140 mg Medicated Plaster in Patients With Impact Injuries of the Limbs

brief_summary.textblock: Phase III, multinational, multicentre, randomized, prospective, double blind, parallel groups, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the analgesic effects of Test Diclofenac Sodium 140mg medicated plaster, Reference DIEP 180 mg medicated plaster, Flector® and Placebo plaster in patients with painful and phlogistic disease due to acute traumatic events of the limbs.

detailed_description.textblock: This will be a Phase III, multinational, multicentre, randomized, prospective, double blind, parallel groups, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the analgesic effects of Test Diclofenac Sodium 140mg medicated plaster (once a day), Reference DIEP 180 mg medicated plaster, Flector® (once a day) and Placebo plaster once a day (i.e. the placebo arm) in patients with painful and phlogistic (inflammatory response) disease due to acute traumatic events (injury/contusion) of the limbs.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in VAS score (Visual Analogue Scale from 0 to 100 mm, where the left extreme means "No pain = 0" while the right extreme means "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100") for pain at rest at 72 ± 2 hours (Day 4) after treatment start.
primary_outcome.description: Non-inferior efficacy of Test (once a day) over Reference (once a day) in reduction of pain after 3 days post-Baseline (72± 2 hours, Day 4), and superior efficacy of Test and Reference to Placebo (once a day) in improving pain at rest at 72 ± 2 hours (Day 4) after Baseline in patients with painful and phlogistic disease due to acute traumatic events of the limbs. A 100-mm Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) will be used for the assessment of pain at rest, from 0 to 100, where "No pain = 0" while "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100".

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC) for pain at rest at Day 4 and Day 8 (SPID0-4d and SPID0-8d)
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test to Reference and Placebo with regard to pain relief (pain at rest and pain on movement) at Day 4 and Day8, assessed through the AUC (Area Under the Curve) of VAS measurements (Visual Analogue Scale from 0 to 100 mm, where the left extreme means "No pain = 0" while the right extreme means "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100") at Day 4 and Day 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of VAS (Visual Analogue Scale 0-100 mm, where "No pain = 0" and "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100") for pain at rest at the other study time-points (including patients' home measurements), from Day 1 to Day 8.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day 3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare efficacy of the Test product to Reference and Placebo with regard to pain relief (pain at rest and pain on movement) from Day 1 to Day 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to resolution of pain at rest, measured through VAS Scale (Visual Analogue Scale 0-100 mm, where "No pain = 0" and "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100") during from Baseline to Day 8.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 until the date of resolution of pain at rest (maximum Day 8)
secondary_outcome.description: To compare efficacy of Test in comparison to Reference and Placebo with regard to time to resolution of pain (pain at rest and pain on movement), measured with VAS score (Visual Analogue Scale 0-100 mm, where "No pain = 0" and "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100").

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in VAS score (Visual Analogue Scale 0-100 mm, where "No pain = 0" and "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100") for pain on movement at 72 ± 2 hours (Day 4) and at 168 ± 2 hours (Day 8) after treatment start
secondary_outcome.description: To compare efficacy of Test to Reference and Placebo with regard to pain relief (pain on movement), measured with VAS score (Visual Analogue Scale 0-100 mm, where "No pain = 0" and "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100") at Day 4 and Day 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of responder patients (defined as a decrease ≥ 50% of baseline VAS (Visual Analogue Scale 0-100 mm, where "No pain = 0" and "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100") for pain at rest and on movement) at 72 ± 2 hours (Day 4) after treatment start
secondary_outcome.description: To compare efficacy of Test to Reference and Placebo with regard to proportion of responders to pain relief (pain at rest and pain on movement) at Day 4, considering a decrease as ≥ 50% of baseline VAS (Visual Analogue Scale 0-100 mm, where "No pain = 0" and "Worst Pain Imaginable = 100")

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients that used rescue medication (paracetamol) from Baseline to Day 8 usign a patient diary
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the proportion of patients that used rescue medication from Baseline to Day 8 among the three treatment arms (Test, Refrence and Placebo) using a patient diary

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of tablets of rescue medication consumed from Baseline to Day 8, using a patient diary
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the amount of consumption of tablets of paracetamol among the three treatment arms (Test, Refrence and Placebo) using a patient diary

secondary_outcome.measure: IMP adhesion, performed daily by patients and at Day 4 and Day 8 by the open staff member; following 5-point ordinal scale: 0:≥90% adhered; 1:≥75% to <90% adhered; 2:≥50% to <75% adhered; 3:<50% adhered but not detached; 4:Plaster detached
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day 3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the adhesion of Test to Reference and Placebo in the site of application from Baseline to Day 8, 5-point ordinal scale: 0:≥90% adhered; 1:≥75% to <90% adhered; 2:≥50% to <75% adhered; 3:<50% adhered but not detached; 4:Plaster detached

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as change from baseline to Day 8 evaluated by physical examination using observation, palpitation, percussion, and auscultation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in patient safety as change from baseline to Day 8 using observation, palpitation, percussion, and auscultation

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as change from baseline to Day 8 evaluated by systolic blood pressure measured in mmHg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in systolic blood pressure, measured in mmHg, as change from baseline to Day 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as change from baseline to Day 8 evaluated by diastolic blood pressure measured in mmHg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in diastolic blood pressure, measured in mmHg, as change from baseline to Day 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as change from baseline to Day 8 evaluated by heart rate measured in bpm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in heart rate, measured in bpm, as change from baseline to Day 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as change from baseline to Day 8 evaluated by tracking the number of patient withdrawals
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in patient safety as change from baseline to Day 8, tracking the number of withdrawals

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as change from baseline to Day 8 evaluated by tracking the number of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day3, Day 4, Day 5,Day 6, Day 7, Day 8
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in patient safety as change from baseline to Day 8, tracking the number of adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Local tolerability (erythema) at the IMP application site by Investigator at Day 1, Day 4 and Day 8 based on a 8-point categorical scale, where 0=no evidence of irritation and 7=strong reaction spreading beyond test site
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in relation to the level of irritation on the application site

secondary_outcome.measure: Local tolerability (itching) at the IMP application site by Investigator at Day 1, Day 4 and Day 8 based on a 4-point categorical scale, where 0=absent and 3=severe
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in relation to the level of itching on the application site

secondary_outcome.measure: Local tolerability (burning) at the IMP application site by Investigator at Day 1, Day 4 and Day 8 based on a 4-point categorical scale, where 0=absent and 3=severe
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in relation to the level of burning on the application site

secondary_outcome.measure: Local tolerability (local pain) at the IMP application site by Investigator at Day 1, Day 4 and Day 8 based on a 4-point categorical scale, where 0=absent and 3=severe
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in relation to the level of local pain on the application site

secondary_outcome.measure: Global assessment of local tolerability at IMP administration site by Investigator and patient according to the following score: 3=excellent; 2=good; 1=fair; 0=poor, assessed at Day 4 and Day 8.
secondary_outcome.description: To compare Test with Reference and Placebo in relation to the global assessment of local tolerability on the application site

arm_group.description: Test product: treated once a day (morning) with the medicated plaster containing 140 mg Diclofenac Sodium for seven days Diclofenac Sodium 140 mg medicated plaster
Reference product: treated once a day (morning) with the medicated plaster containing DIEP 180 mg, Flector® for seven days Diclofenac epolamine (DIEP) 180 mg medicated plaster, Flector®
Placebo: treated once a day (morning) with the placebo plaster for seven days

intervention.description: Test product: Diclofenac Sodium 140 mg medicated plaster, topical application once a day
Reference product: Active-comparator, Diclofenac epolamine (DIEP) 180 mg medicated plaster, Flector®, topical application once a day
Placebo: Placebo plaster, topical application once a day.

facility.name: Magyar Honvédség, Egészségügyi Központ Baleseti Sebészeti Osztály
Bács-Kiskun Megyei Kórház Kiskunfélegyházi Városi Kórház és Rendelőintézet
